edu.umass.cs.gnsclient.client

Class GNSClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.gnsclient.client.GNSClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GNSClientCommands

    public class GNSClient
extends Object
    Author:
    arun Cleaner implementation of a GNS client using gigapaxos' async client.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GNSClient()
      The default constructor that expects a gigapaxos properties file that is either at the default location, PaxosConfig.DEFAULT_GIGAPAXOS_CONFIG_FILE relative to the current directory, or is specified as a JVM property as -DgigapaxosConfig=absoluteFilePath.
      GNSClient(InetSocketAddress anyReconfigurator)
      Bootstrap with a single, arbitrarily chosen valid reconfigurator address.
      GNSClient(String anyReconfiguratorHostName)
      Same as GNSClient(InetSocketAddress) but with the host name anyReconfiguratorHostName and implicitly the default reconfigurator port GNSConfig.DEFAULT_RECONFIGURATOR_PORT.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GNSClient

        public GNSClient()
          throws IOException
        The default constructor that expects a gigapaxos properties file that is either at the default location, PaxosConfig.DEFAULT_GIGAPAXOS_CONFIG_FILE relative to the current directory, or is specified as a JVM property as -DgigapaxosConfig=absoluteFilePath. To use GNSClient with default properties without a properties file, use GNSClient(InetSocketAddress) that requires knowledge of at least one reconfigurator address. If this default constructor is used and the client is unable to find the properties file, it will attempt to connect to localhost:GNSConfig.DEFAULT_RECONFIGURATOR_PORT.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • GNSClient

        public GNSClient(InetSocketAddress anyReconfigurator)
          throws IOException
        Bootstrap with a single, arbitrarily chosen valid reconfigurator address. The client can enquire and know of other reconfigurator addresses from this reconfigurator. If the supplied argument is null, the behavior will be identical to GNSClient().
        Parameters:
        anyReconfigurator -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • GNSClient

        public GNSClient(String anyReconfiguratorHostName)
          throws IOException
        Same as GNSClient(InetSocketAddress) but with the host name anyReconfiguratorHostName and implicitly the default reconfigurator port GNSConfig.DEFAULT_RECONFIGURATOR_PORT. If the supplied argument is null, the behavior will be identical to GNSClient().
        Parameters:
        anyReconfiguratorHostName -
        Throws:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • getGNSProvider

        public String getGNSProvider()
        This name represents the service to which this client connects. Currently this name is unused as the reconfigurator(s) are read from a properties file, but it is conceivable also to use a well known service to query for the reconfigurators given this name. This name is currently also used by the client key database to distinguish between stores corresponding to different GNS services.

        This name can be changed by setting the system property "GNS" as "-DGNS=".

        Returns:
        GNS service instance

        public InetSocketAddress getGNSProxy()

      • setGNSProxy

        public void setGNSProxy(InetSocketAddress LNS)
        Parameters:
        LNS - The address of a GNS proxy if any. Setting this parameter to null (also the default value) disables the use of a proxy.
